Apply 30-Day Aging Bins

Source: R/aging.R
bin_aging.Rd

Apply 30-Day Aging Bins

Usage

bin_aging(df, date, bin_type = "chop")

Arguments

df

<data.frame> or <tibble>

date

column of <date>s

bin_type

<chr> string specifying the bin type; one of "chop", "cut" or "ivs"

Value

a tibble

Examples

binned <- bin_aging(
  df = load_ex("aging_ex"),
  date = dos
) |>
  dplyr::select(
    dos:ins_class,
    dar:aging_bin
  )

head(binned)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 6
#>   dos        charges ins_name   ins_class   dar aging_bin 
#>   <date>       <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     <int> <fct>     
#> 1 2023-12-27    390. Medicare   Primary     145 (120, 150]
#> 2 2023-12-27    173. Patient    Patient     145 (120, 150]
#> 3 2023-12-27    246. Blue Cross Primary     145 (120, 150]
#> 4 2023-12-27    507. AETNA      Primary     145 (120, 150]
#> 5 2023-12-27    483. Blue Cross Primary     145 (120, 150]
#> 6 2023-12-27    399. AETNA      Secondary   145 (120, 150]

binned |>
  dplyr::arrange(aging_bin) |>
  dplyr::summarise(n_claims = dplyr::n(),
                   balance = sum(charges),
                   .by = aging_bin) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    tot_claims = sum(n_claims),
    tot_balance = sum(balance),
    pct_claims = n_claims / tot_claims,
    pct_balance = balance / tot_balance) |>
  print(n = 50)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 7
#>   aging_bin  n_claims balance tot_claims tot_balance pct_claims pct_balance
#>   <fct>         <int>   <dbl>      <int>       <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 (0, 30]        1037 503294.       2618    1300942.      0.396       0.387
#> 2 (30, 60]        385 198115.       2618    1300942.      0.147       0.152
#> 3 (60, 90]        455 220866.       2618    1300942.      0.174       0.170
#> 4 (90, 120]       419 210766.       2618    1300942.      0.160       0.162
#> 5 (120, 150]      322 167902.       2618    1300942.      0.123       0.129

binned |>
  dplyr::arrange(aging_bin, ins_name) |>
  dplyr::summarise(
    n_claims = dplyr::n(),
    balance = sum(charges),
    .by = c(aging_bin, ins_name)
  ) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    tot_claims = sum(n_claims),
    tot_balance = sum(balance),
    pct_claims = n_claims / tot_claims,
    pct_balance = balance / tot_balance) |>
  print(n = 50)
#> # A tibble: 30 × 8

binned |>
  dplyr::arrange(ins_name, aging_bin) |>
  dplyr::summarise(
    n_claims = dplyr::n(),
    balance = sum(charges),
    .by = c(aging_bin, ins_name)
  ) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    tot_claims = sum(n_claims),
    tot_balance = sum(balance),
    pct_claims = n_claims / tot_claims,
    pct_balance = balance / tot_balance,
    .by = ins_name) |>
  print(n = 50)
